summary: The Clerk of the House of Representatives, All Staff Employees, served as the administrative body responsible for managing and processing payroll records for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from 1976 to 1979, and in some cases, related reviews extending to 1995. The office handled payroll authorization forms, memoranda, and notifications, including those from the Assassination Records Review Board concerning the postponement of Social Security number releases to protect personal privacy. These documents detail the employment history, salary adjustments, and position changes of HSCA staff members, highlighting the Clerk's essential role in the financial operations and administrative processes of the HSCA.
significance: High. The Clerk of the House of Representatives played a crucial administrative role in managing the payroll and personnel records of the HSCA, as evidenced by the large number of documents (55) related to this function. The Clerk's office was essential for the HSCA's operations, ensuring proper compensation and record-keeping.
merged_from_variants: Clerk of the House of Representatives
Clerk of the House of Representatives, All Staff Employees
Clerk of the House of Representatives, All Staff
